item.title: North Korean Hackers Have Stolen $2 Billion in Cryptocurrency in 2025
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The hackers are believed to have stolen over $6 billion for the Pyongyang regime, financing its military programs.

The post North Korean Hackers Have Stolen $2 Billion in Cryptocurrency in 2025 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Radiflow Unveils New OT Security Platform
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Radiflow360 provides enhanced visibility, risk management, and incident response capabilities for mid-sized industrial enterprises. 

The post Radiflow Unveils New OT Security Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Beer Giant Asahi
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The hackers claim the theft of 27 gigabytes of data, including contracts, employee information, and financial documents.

The post Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Beer Giant Asahi appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: DraftKings Warns Users of Credential Stuffing Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Hackers accessed user accounts and compromised names, addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, and other information.

The post DraftKings Warns Users of Credential Stuffing Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Exploitation of Oracle EBS Zero-Day Started 2 Months Before Patching
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Hundreds of internet-exposed Oracle E-Business Suite instances may still be vulnerable to attacks.

The post Exploitation of Oracle EBS Zero-Day Started 2 Months Before Patching appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Stole Data From Public Safety Comms Firm BK Technologies
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
BK Technologies has informed the SEC that it discovered an IT intrusion on September 20. 

The post Hackers Stole Data From Public Safety Comms Firm BK Technologies appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 40 Deals Announced in September 2025
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Significant cybersecurity M&A deals announced by Check Point, CrowdStrike, F5, Mitsubishi Electric, and SentinelOne.

item.title: Filigran Raises $58 Million in Series C Funding
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The company plans to expand to new markets, fuel the development of a new module for its platform, and accelerate AI integration.

The post Filigran Raises $58 Million in Series C Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Security Firm Exposes Role of Beijing Research Institute in China’s Cyber Operations
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
BIETA and its subsidiary CIII research develop and sell technologies supporting China’s intelligence, counterintelligence, and military operations.

The post Security Firm Exposes Role of Beijing Research Institute in China’s Cyber Operations appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Zero-Day Exploited in Ransomware Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The Medusa ransomware operators exploited the GoAnywhere MFT vulnerability one week before patches were released.

The post Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Zero-Day Exploited in Ransomware Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.
